question: Which island houses the cetacean conservation organization "Globice"?
explanation: Globice, also known as the Local Group of Observation and Identification of Cetaceans, is an NGO formed for the protection of marine mammals of the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France in the Indian Ocean. This NGO was created in 2001 which is dedicated to the science and conservation of cetaceans in Reunion Island and the Indian Ocean. This NGO is also a member of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) since 2006.
